channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Pigeons trapped in netting, 24th June
item.description:
We just got new netting at the front of the house and they left some pigeons with babies inside the net. There are already dead pigeons on the bottom of the net.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hillingdon Street, Camberwell, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: On the pavement outside 5 Cavendish Road NW6 7XP, 24th June
item.description:
2 dumped beds and mattresses.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Cavendish Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Fly-tip Large - More than a van load

item.title: Sinking, uneven pavement, hazard, 24th June
item.description:
Since Dec 2024, the pavement wasn't repaired (I raised this issue in Dec 2024). Hazard for walkers, pushchairs, kids on bikes, disabled...

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 346, Rotherhithe Street, Rotherhithe, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavements and roads not weeded and swept, 24th June
item.description:
There has been no regular road sweeping or pavement cleaning since my last email in NOVEMBER 24 .Note this must be done manually as access is difficult . The repair to the entry of WESTMOAT CLOSE is also falling apart again .
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): West Moat Close, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Awful metal pole in the park, 24th June
item.description:
An old and neglected metal pole (old street lamp) should be either removed or painted. The bin also needs replacement. If neglected, attract attentions of vandales.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Beatson Walk, Rotherhithe, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Hope Avenue at the corner with Kingswood Avenue, 24th June
item.description:
Blue bag, which is already attracting rubbish from passers-by such as dog poo bags

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Kingswood Avenue, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Street cleaning - Blue bags left on street

item.title: Uneven pavements made me trip and seriously injure myself, 24th June
item.description:
There has been issues since I moved in on queens Road / Peckham high street especially around the police office with problems with the pavements being uneven. I was carrying my shopping home and unfortunately I tripped on one of these and fell and seriously injured my face, back and arms.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cobden Walk, Peckham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Illegally parked cars, 24th June
item.description:
Here is where the Primitive butcher and the motor cycle garage have each parked their vehicles on the double yellow lines meaning two carâ€™s cannot enter or leave an no fire engine will be able to turn into Acacia Road.

item.title: Three different trees, making it impossible for anyone elderly, buggy, or wheelchair to get through., 24th June
item.description:
Far too many trees are over hanging the pavements. Larmans Road is dreadful

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Larmans Road, London

item.description:

item.title: Broken tarmac base of lamppost, 24th June
item.description:
A car hit this lamppost yesterday and now the tarmac base is broken up. I wonder how safe the lamp post is.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 59, Half Moon Lane, Dulwich Village, London

item.title: FP158A Blocked by Fence, 24th June
item.description:
I'm a regular user of this path and where FP158A goes from Chapmans Lane Track to the golf course someone has erected a wooden fence block access. This has only happned over the last couple of weeks and needs to be removed or turned into something that doesn't stop walkers using the path.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chapman's Lane, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Wait button not working, 24th June
item.description:
The light on the wait button comes on when pressed, but then goes out without the pedestrian crossing light changing to green. It has been like this for over a week.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Torridon Road, Catford South, London

item.title: Fallen tree opposite 27 stane way, 24th June
item.description:
Tree that has fallen on to the metal fence of hornfair park opposite 27 stane way an it's gonna take someone's eye out as the branches are sticking out everywhere. Very dangerous.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stane Way, Charlton, London

item.title: Lots of glass on the road, 24th June
item.description:
People regularly smash glass inside their vans. As a result there is a large amount of broken glass in the road both outside their house and in other places around the roundabout.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Somerhill Road, Welling, London
